extracted_data.oldest_reference_title: The correlation theory of brain function
extracted_data.citation_claim: One of its two networks has "fast weights" or "dynamic links" (1981).[17][18][19] — in context: "The linearly scaling fast weight controller (1992) learns to compute a weight matrix for further processing depending on the input. One of its two networks has 'fast weights' or 'dynamic links' (1981)."
extracted_data.citation_accuracy_assessment: accurate — The von der Malsburg (1981) paper on the correlation theory of brain function introduced the concept of 'dynamic links' (dynamic connections) in neural networks, which is exactly what the Wikipedia article cites it for. The reference correctly supports the claim about the historical origin of the 'dynamic links' concept used in the fast weight controller architecture.
